page.title: 02More about Ponteland
page.content: {Farming.}The greater part of the area is undulating land with a maximum height of 89 metres.farming is generally mixed arable and livestock. In many cases the farmland is owned by a country landowner. Farming is done by tenant farmers,a number of whom have been doing so for 30 or 40 years. There is a band of poor{wetland running West to East across the middle of the area which has numerous manmade drainage ditches which only partially solve the problem.The farmhouses are built of the local light brown sandstone and the fields are bound by fences and hedges. {Golf.}There is an 18 hole golf course which lies to the East of the village of Ponteland.It covers an area of almost half a square kilometre and draws its members from Ponteland and the surrounding area.
